title: Can you really tell if a kid is lying?
description: Are children poor liars? Do you think you can easily detect their lies? Developmental researcher Kang Lee studies what happens physiologically to children when they lie. They do it a lot, starting as young as two years old, and they're actually really good at it. Lee explains why we should celebrate when kids start to lie and presents new lie-detection technology that could someday reveal our hidden emotions.
author: Kang Lee
keywords: TED, talks, body language, communication, decision-making, intelligence, teaching, motivation, parenting, children, psychology, emotions
